Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Okay, lets tackle this problem step by step. The goal is to group the given hospital process events into distinct patient journeys cases based on their attributes and logical order.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, I need to look for patterns in the data that might indicate which events belong together. Key factors here would be: Patient demographics age gender Sequential activities Timing of events

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Lets start by looking at each event 12 Registration in ER for two different patients 3 Registration in Surgery department

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 45 Initial triage in ER for the patients registered earlier The patient ages and genders match with 1 and 2 so likely these are linked to those registrations

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 6 Consultation in Surgery for a new patient patient age 28 Since this is after registration in event 3 this seems to belong to that case

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 79 Events related to the ER patients Triage code indicates urgency followed by Xray and lab tests These events align with the first two registrations

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 10 Lab test completion for patient age 62 matching event 2 confirming part of their journey in ER

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 1113 More doctor consultations leading to diagnoses and procedures The ages match previous entries

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Events like 1417 are followup actions after treatments which should be grouped with the earlier events based on patient demographics

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Lastly event 18 is a discharge for the surgery case patient age 28

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So each unique combination of age and gender would form a distinct case Lets map these out
